sections.title: Statement of Cash Flows
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IAS 7.

items.question: If an entity applies the Amendments to IAS 7 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that fact?
Are the cash flows during the period classified by operating, investing and financing activities?
Does the entity classify dividends paid as cash flows from financing activities?
Does the entity classify interest paid (as described in IAS 7.32) as cash flows from financing activities?
Does the entity classify interest and dividends received as cash flows from investing activities?

Does such an entity classify the total of each of these cash flows in a single category in the statement of cash flows (that is, either as operating, investing or financing activities), associated with the categories of the statement of profit or loss?
Does the entity report cash flows from operating activities using the direct method, disclosing major classes of gross cash receipts and gross cash payments (this method is encouraged)?

Does the entity report cash flows from operating activities using the indirect method, in which the entity adjusts profit or loss (or operating profit or loss, if the entity early adopts IFRS 18) for cash flows from operating activities for which the associated income or expenses are not classified in the operating category of the statement of profit or loss?
Does the entity report major classes of gross cash receipts and gross cash payments arising from investing and financing activities separately, except as described in IAS 7.22 below?
Are cash receipts and payments on behalf of customers, if the cash flows reflect the activities of the customer rather than those of the entity, reported on a net basis?
Are cash receipts and payments for items in which the turnover is quick, the amounts are large and the maturities are short reported on a net basis?
Does the entity disclose the components of cash and cash equivalents?
Does the entity disclose the policy for determining the composition of cash and cash equivalents?
Does the entity reconcile the amounts of cash and cash equivalents in the statement of cash flows with the equivalent items in the statement of financial position?
Have the aggregate cash flows arising from obtaining control of subsidiaries or other businesses been presented separately and classified as investing activities in the statement of cash flows?
Does the entity disclose the total consideration paid or received for obtaining control of subsidiaries or other businesses during the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose the portion of the consideration consisting of cash and cash equivalents?
Does the entity disclose the amount of cash and cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or other businesses over which control is obtained?

Does the entity disclose the amount of the assets and liabilities other than cash or cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or businesses over which control is obtained, summarised by each major category?
Have the aggregate cash flows arising from losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses been presented separately and classified as investing activities in the statement of cash flows?
Does the entity disclose the total consideration paid or received for losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses during the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose the portion of the consideration consisting of cash and cash equivalents?
Does the entity disclose the amount of cash and cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or other businesses over which control is lost?
Does the entity disclose the amount of the assets and liabilities other than cash or cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or businesses over which control is lost, summarised by each major category?

Does the entity separately present the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held or due in a foreign currency in the statement of cash flows in order to reconcile cash and cash equivalents at the beginning and the end of the period?
Does the entity separately disclose the cash inflow from interest?
Does the entity separately disclose the cash outflow from interest?
Does the entity separately disclose the cash inflow from dividends?
Does the entity separately disclose the cash outflow from dividends?

Cash flows arising from taxes on income must be separately disclosed and must be classified as cash flows from operating activities unless they can be specifically identified with financing and investing activities. If the entity allocates tax cash flows to more than one class of activity, does the entity disclose the total amount of taxes paid?
Are investing and financing transactions that do not require the use of cash or cash equivalents excluded from the statement of cash flows?

Are investing and financing transactions that do not require the use of cash or cash equivalents disclosed elsewhere in the financial statements in a way that provides all the relevant information about these investing and financing activities?
Does the entity disclose the amount of significant cash and cash equivalent balances held that are not available for use by the group?
Does the entity provide a commentary by management regarding significant cash and cash equivalent balances held that are not available for use by the group?

Does the entity disclose the amount of undrawn borrowing facilities that may be available in the future for operating activities and settling capital commitments, and indicate any restrictions on the use of these facilities?
Does the entity disclose changes from financing cash flows affecting liabilities arising from financing activities?
Does the entity disclose changes arising from obtaining or losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses affecting liabilities arising from financing activities?
Does the entity disclose the effect of changes in foreign exchange rates on liabilities arising from financing activities?
Does the entity disclose changes in fair values affecting liabilities arising from financing activities?
Does the entity disclose other non-cash changes affecting liabilities arising from financing activities?

If the entity discloses the information required by IAS 7.44A by providing a reconciliation between the opening and closing balances in the statement of financial position for liabilities arising from financing activities, does it provide sufficient information to enable users of the financial statements to link items included in the reconciliation to the statement of financial position and the statement of cash flows?

If the entity provides the disclosure required by IAS 7.44A in combination with disclosures of changes in other assets and liabilities, does it disclose the changes in liabilities arising from financing activities separately from changes in those other assets and liabilities?

To meet the objectives in paragraph 44F, does the entity disclose the terms and conditions of its supplier finance arrangements, and disclose separately the terms and conditions of arrangements that have dissimilar terms and conditions?

To meet the objectives in paragraph 44F, does the entity disclose, as at the beginning and end of the reporting period, the carrying amounts and associated line items presented in the entity’s statement of financial position of the financial liabilities that are part of a supplier finance arrangement; the carrying amounts and associated line items of the financial liabilities disclosed under (i) for which suppliers have already received payment from the finance providers; and the range of payment due dates (for example, 30–40 days after the invoice date) for both the financial liabilities disclosed under (i) and comparable trade payables that are not part of a supplier finance arrangement?
To meet the objectives in paragraph 44F, does the entity disclose the type and effect of non-cash changes in the carrying amounts of the financial liabilities disclosed under (b)(i)?
